page.title: 01ANCIENT KIRBY
page.content: Kirby used to be near to where Birch Hall Farm is today because it was higher ground.They moved down to where there was a better water supply. Kirby used to be the biggest of the Sokens but now is one of the smallest. The cottages were made mostly of timbers and the two still standing today were called Dane Cottage and Meadow View.They were semidetached so you had to go up the stairs once to get into Dane Cottage then up some more stairs next door to get up stairs in Meadow View. You could date buildings by the joins of the timber frames. These cottages were found to have old fashioned Scadinavion join and were build in about 1530 just after the church was build.Kirby was in the original Domesday Book.
